bookmarks.note: SO THIS AREA IS THE MOST IMPORTANT. The area around this bookmark includes what foods to eat and/or not eat regarding sugar
In terms of sweet food: avoid 15g+ foods per serving. Instead, she suggests low glycemic: raw agave syrup, brown rice syrup, and fruit sweetener. And stevia (advertisement?)
At least one salad each day made of rock greens and vegetables (add protein and healthy fat to make it a complete meal)
Note: soy sauce is made from wheat and beer is made from barley, so you have to remove those two as well in order to get rid of gluten

Essential FAs:
Omega-3: CPA? & DHA in fish oil
Omega-6: GLA (found in black currant, primrose)
Found in fish (wild salmon and sardines), nuts (almonds, walnuts), seeds (sunflower/pumpkin), leafy greens (kale and Swiss chard)
Bad fats -> increase arachidonic? acid -> increase eicosanoids
Remove *all* trans fats from your foods

Eliminate any food made with white sugar or white flour (high glycemic carbs): bagels, bread, breakfast cereals, cakes, cookies, crackers, candy, and soft drinks. Also watch out for foods where sugar is hiding: commercial yogurts, commercial fruit smoothies, etc.
